title: Coronation Street spoilers: Christmas Day death revealed by cast?
text:
Normally, you can rely on Coronation Street to supply a bit of festive cheer and comedy over Christmas – albeit with the occasional scene of Liz McDonald being run over by Jenny Connor and Billy Mayhew being lobbed off a cliff. But this year, it looks like they are entering the more dramatic and gritty territory – and Jennie McAlpine is not ruling out a shock death. Yikes!

At the moment, Fiz is being stalked by a strange nanny called Jade, who appears to have quite the vendetta towards her. And with Jennie confirming that Fiz will be very busy over Christmas, could Jade’s true intentions and dangerous side come to the fore – with tragic results?

Speaking to the Daily Star Sunday, Jennie said: ‘I’ve read the script for Christmas Eve. It’s quite dramatic. I’m not sure if I’ll be getting any turkey this year. Fiz is going to be quite busy! It’s not all mistletoe and jingle bells. I can’t say if anyone dies. If I told someone that, I’d have to kill them!’

Sally Ann Matthews, who was central to last year’s cliffhanger, added: ‘I’ve just received scripts for Christmas. What I can say is it’s beyond dramatic. It’s big and edge-of-your-seat stuff. It’s not just one story either.

‘There are several big stories happening. We usually have feel-good Christmas episodes. And this year it certainly starts off that way. People will want to tune in for it on Christmas Day. My advice is not to have too much turkey and eggnog so you’ll still be awake enough to watch it!’

Sounds exciting – and there is no let up in the heavy hitting drama either across the autumn. Not only is there the death of Sinead Tinker in some of the most heartbreaking scenes in a long time but there will be a stabbing during a prison riot and a Christmas showdown as the truth about sex abuser Kel is revealed.
